definitions.definition: To stay after others or other parts have been removed or otherwise disappeared.
examples: After three rounds of interviews, only 5 candidates remained .
I like to make more than enough food if I have people round for dinner, so I can eat my way through what remains in the following days.

definitions.definition: To be left after a number or quantity has been subtracted or cut off; to be left as not included or comprised.
examples: If you divide 20 apples between three people, each gets six and two remain .

definitions.definition: To continue unchanged in place, form, or condition, or undiminished in quantity; to abide; to stay; to endure; to last.
examples: Promise me you will always remain my good little girl.

definitions.definition: To await ; to be left to.
To continue in a state of being.
examples: There was no food in the house, so I had to remain hungry.
The light remained red for two full minutes.

main_definition: To stay after others or other parts have been removed or otherwise disappeared.
secondary_definitions: ( mathematics ) To be left after a number or quantity has been subtracted or cut off; to be left as not included or comprised.
To continue unchanged in place, form, or condition, or undiminished in quantity; to abide; to stay; to endure; to last.
To await ; to be left to.
( copulative ) To continue in a state of being.
